question: Which of the following statements is correct about the Countervailing duty?
option1: It is the tariff levied on imported goods to offset subsidies offered by the exporting country to its producers
option2: It is the tariff imposed on exported goods to reduce exports and increase the domestic supply
option3: It is the tax levied on revenues received by a corporation, even if it does not make any profit
option4: It is the tax levied on purchase or sale of various financial products like stocks, derivatives, mutual funds etc
answer: It is the tariff levied on imported goods to offset subsidies offered by the exporting country to its producers
explanation:
First option is the correct answer
Countervailing duty is a tariff imposed on imported goods to offset the subsidies offered by the exporting country to its producers. It is imposed to provide level playing field to domestic producers and foreign producers.
